title: Authors and Citation
text: Chen Q, Wang S (2022). MPTevol: Clonal Evolutionary History Metastatic Routines Analysis Multiple Primary Tumors. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MPTevol: Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for Multiple Primary Tumors},   author = {Qinjian Chen and Shixiang Wang},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what:
Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for
    Multiple Primary Tumors
title:
Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for
    Multiple Primary Tumors
text: goal MPTevol provide practical computation framework dissecting evolution multiple primary tumors (MPT), reducing analysis complexity modular design. Package Overview:  using MPTevol academic research, please cite paper: Deciphering clonal dynamics metastatic routines rare patient synchronous triple primary tumors multiple metastases MPTevol.

title:
Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for
    Multiple Primary Tumors
text: can install development version MPTevol GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("qingjian1991/MPTevol")

what: calKaKs calculates the Ka/Ks of each group — calKaKs
title: calKaKs calculates the Ka/Ks of each group — calKaKs
text: mutations classified classifyMut() internally.

title: calKaKs calculates the Ka/Ks of each group — calKaKs
code: calKaKs(   maf,   patient.id = NULL,   class = "SP",   classByTumor = FALSE,   vaf_cutoff = 0.05,   parallel = TRUE )

title: calKaKs calculates the Ka/Ks of each group — calKaKs
text: maf Maf MafList object generated readMaf() function class class represented. "SP" (Shared pattern: Public/Shared/Private), options: "CS" (Clonal status: Clonal/Subclonl) "SPCS". see MesKit::classifyMut(). vaf_cutoff Removing mutations low variant allele frequency (VAF). parallel TRUE (default), run parallel.

title: calKaKs calculates the Ka/Ks of each group — calKaKs
code: library(MesKit) data.type <- "split1"  maf <- readMaf(   mafFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.mutation.txt", data.type)),   ccfFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.CCF.txt", data.type)),   clinicalFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.clinical.txt", data.type)),   refBuild = "hg19",   ccf.conf.level = 0.95 )  # calKaKas kaks <- calKaKs(maf, patient.id = "Breast", class = "SP", parallel = TRUE, vaf_cutoff = 0.05) kaks kaks <- calKaKs(maf, patient.id = "Breast", class = "CS", parallel = TRUE, vaf_cutoff = 0.05) kaks kaks <- calKaKs(maf, class = "SP", parallel = TRUE, vaf_cutoff = 0.05) kaks

what: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
title: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
text: calRoutines calculates H index JSI index according pair-wise comparison CCF

title: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
code: calRoutines(   maf,   PrimaryId,   patient.id = NULL,   CCF_cutoff = 0.1,   pairByTumor = TRUE,   use.tumorSampleLabel = FALSE,   maf_drivers = NULL,   subtitle = "both",   ... )

title: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
text: maf Maf MafList object generated MesKit::readMaf() function. PrimaryId Primary tumor IDs indicate primary-metastases relationships. patient.id Select specific patients. Default NULL, patients included. CCF_cutoff minimal cutoffs present status. mutations CCF smaller CCF_cutoff consider absent statuses. pairByTumor Compare JSI different tumors. Default TRUE. use.tumorSampleLabel Logical (Default: FALSE). Rename 'Tumor_Sample_Barcode' 'Tumor_Sample_Label'. maf_drivers Driver information. Two columns required, including "Mut_ID" ".driver". provided, add driver mutations plot. "Mut_ID" = str_c(Chromosome, Start_Position, Reference_Allele , Tumor_Seq_Allele2, sep = ":") subtitle information shows subtitle. Options including "JSI", "Hindex", "" "none". Default "" ... options passed MesKit::subMaf().

title: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
text: H index. Hu, Z., et al., Quantitative evidence early metastatic seeding colorectal cancer. Nat Genet, 2019. 51(7): p. 1113-1122. JSI index. Hu, Z., et al., Multi-cancer analysis clonality timing systemic spread paired primary tumors metastases. Nat Genet, 2020. 52(7): p. 701-708.

title: calRoutines calculates the H index and JSI index according to the pair-wise comparison of CCF — calRoutines
code: library(MesKit) data.type <- "split1"  maf <- readMaf(   mafFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.mutation.txt", data.type)),   ccfFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.CCF.txt", data.type)),   clinicalFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.clinical.txt", data.type)),   refBuild = "hg19",   ccf.conf.level = 0.95 ) cal <- calRoutines(   maf = maf,   patient.id = "Met1",   PrimaryId = "Coad",   pairByTumor = TRUE,   use.tumorSampleLabel = TRUE,   subtitle = "both" )  plot_grid(plotlist = cal$Met1$plist, nrow = 1) ## add driver information maf_driver <- data.frame(   Mut_ID = c("5:112170777:CAGA:-", "1:147092680:-:C"),   is.driver = c(TRUE, TRUE) ) cal <- calRoutines(   maf = maf,   patient.id = "Met1",   PrimaryId = "Coad",   pairByTumor = TRUE,   use.tumorSampleLabel = TRUE,   subtitle = "both",   maf_drivers = maf_driver )  plot_grid(plotlist = cal$Met1$plist, nrow = 1)

what: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
title: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
text: getClinSites captures clinical targetable sites oncokb based mutation status

title: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
code: getClinSites(maf, Patient_ID = NULL)

title: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
text: maf Maf MafList object generated readMaf function Patient_ID Patient_ID. See specific patient.

title: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
text: match drivers genes maf files clinical sites oncokb. match gene names, whereas ignoring cancer types gene alterations. main targertable alterations include gene fusions (like BCR-ABL1 fusion), Oncogenic mutations, Exon deletions/insertion, Amplifications, Deletions Singles-nucleotide mutation (BRAC V600E). Please mannual check mutation status.

title: getClinSites captures the clinical targetable sites of oncokb based on the mutation status — getClinSites
code: library(MesKit) data.type <- "split1"  maf <- readMaf(   mafFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.mutation.txt", data.type)),   ccfFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.CCF.txt", data.type)),   clinicalFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.clinical.txt", data.type)),   refBuild = "hg19",   ccf.conf.level = 0.95 )  # see clinical targetable sites sites <- getClinSites(maf)  # see one patinets sites <- getClinSites(maf, Patient_ID = "Breast")  # View data DT::datatable(sites)

what: getKaKs compares Ka/Ks between different groups — getKaKs
title: getKaKs compares Ka/Ks between different groups — getKaKs
text: getKaKs compares Ka/Ks different groups

title: getKaKs compares Ka/Ks between different groups — getKaKs
code: getKaKs(df, vaf_cutoff = 0.05)

title: getKaKs compares Ka/Ks between different groups — getKaKs
text: df data. Six columns required calculate Ka/Ks, including "Tumor_Sample_Barcode","Chromosome","Start_Position", "Reference_Allele","Tumor_Seq_Allele2" "VAF". vaf_cutoff VAF cutoff. Removing mutations low variant allele frequency (VAF).

title: inferClonalTrees — inferClonalTrees
text: function two main modules, including inferring clonal trees plot clonal models.

title: inferClonalTrees — inferClonalTrees
code: inferClonalTrees(   project.names,   variants,   vaf.col.names = NULL,   ccf.col.names = NULL,   sample.groups = NULL,   founding.cluster = 1,   ignore.clusters = NULL,   cluster.col.name = "cluster",   clone.colors = NULL,   subclonal.test.model = "non-parametric",   cancer.initiation.model = "monoclonal",   sum.p = 0.05,   alpha = 0.05,   weighted = FALSE,   consensus.tree = TRUE,   plot.models = TRUE,   plot.pairwise.CCF = F,   highlight.note.col.name = NULL,   highlight = "is.driver",   highlight.CCF = FALSE )

title: inferClonalTrees — inferClonalTrees
text: project.names project names used output. variants data frame variants. least cluster column VAF CCF columns required. Cluster column contain cluster identities continuous integer values starting 1. vaf.col.names column names samples containing VAF. ccf.col.names column names samples containing CCF. Note: either setting vaf.col.names ccf.col.names. sample.groups indicate samples groups. example setNames(c("Primary","Primary","Met","Met"), nm = c("P1","P2","M1","M1") ) founding.cluster name founding clones, one important parameters. circumstances, founding cluster cluster highest average CCF cluster. ignore.clusters clusters ignores analysis. clusters, especially clusters low vafs samples, probably false-positive clusters. cluster.col.name column names containing cluster information. clone.colors setting clone colors. subclonal.test.model model use generating bootstrap values : c('non-parametric', 'normal', 'normal-truncated', 'beta', 'beta-binomial'). (Default = "non-parametric") cancer.initiation.model cancer evolution model use, c('monoclonal', 'polyclonal'). Monoclonal model assumes orginal tumor (eg. primary tumor) arises single normal cell; polyclonal model assumes original tumor can arise multiple cells (ie. multiple founding clones). polyclonal model, total VAF separate founding clones must exceed 0.5. sum.p min probability cluster non-negative sample(Default = 0.05). alpha alpha level confidence interval estimate cluster (Default = 0.05). weighted weighted model (default = FALSE) consensus.tree whether build consensus tree (Default = TRUE). plot.models whether plot models (Default = TRUE). plot.pairwise.CCF whether plot pairwise CCF comparison (Default = FALSE). highlight.note.col.name highlight context. highlight column name indicate whether highlight sites (TRUE FALSE). highlight.CCF highlight CCF VAF (Default = FALSE).

title: inferClonalTrees — inferClonalTrees
text: Inferring clonal trees central process clonal construction. However, users always find difficult build clonal trees. Therefore, check cluster structures building clonal trees. suggestions building clonal trees. chose optimal clustering methods. mutation clustering. removing low-quality mutations. indels suggested removed. mutations LOH regions suggested removed. mutations cnv-regions carefully checked. chose right founding cluster. ignore false-negative clusters. clusters, especially clusters low vafs samples, probably false-positive clusters. Removing clusters mutations. try different cutoffs. two parameters sum.p alpha used determine whether cluster sample. relaxed cutoffs (small values two parameters) enables clusters though present sample.

what: MPTevol: Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for Multiple Primary Tumors — MPTevol-package
title: MPTevol: Clonal Evolutionary History and Metastatic Routines Analysis for Multiple Primary Tumors — MPTevol-package
text: Provides practical computation framework dissecting evolution multiple primary tumors (MPT), reducing analysis complexity modular design.

what: plotCNAtree plots phylogenetic trees of CNAs — plotCNAtree
title: plotCNAtree plots phylogenetic trees of CNAs — plotCNAtree
text: CNAs trees constructed MEDICC.

title: plotCNAtree plots phylogenetic trees of CNAs — plotCNAtree
code: plotCNAtree(   dist,   bootstrap.rep.num = 500,   group = NULL,   group.colors = NULL,   title = "Cancer",   normal.node = "NORMAL",   hexpand_ratio = 0.3 )

title: plotCNAtree plots phylogenetic trees of CNAs — plotCNAtree
text: dist dist files generated MEDICC. bootstrap.rep.num number bootstrap steps. group list used indicate sample groups group.colors array indicates colors sample groups. title title plot. normal.node sample name normal sample tree. hexpand_ratio hexpand ratio. see hexpand

title: plotCNAtree plots phylogenetic trees of CNAs — plotCNAtree
code: # read samples distances. # This dist file is the output of MEDICC dist <- system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", "tree_final.dist")  # set group information group <- list(   NORMAL = "NORMAL",   Breast = paste0("Breast_", 1:5),   Coad = paste0("Coad_", 1:5),   Lung = paste0("Lung_", 1:5),   OveryLM = paste0("OveryLM_", 1:5),   OveryRM = paste0("OveryRM_", 1:6),   UterusM = paste0("UterusM_", c(1:7)) )  # set group colors group.colors <- setNames(set.colors(n = length(group)), nm = names(group))  # built trees tree <- plotCNAtree(   dist = dist,   group = group,   group.colors = group.colors )  tree$plot

what: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations — plotMutTree
title: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations — plotMutTree
text: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree mutations

title: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations — plotMutTree
code: plotMutTree(   maf,   patient.id,   method = "NJ",   min.vaf = 0.02,   bootstrap.rep.num = 500,   group = NULL,   group.colors = NULL,   title = "cancer",   hexpand_ratio = 0.3,   ... )

title: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations — plotMutTree
text: maf Maf MafList object generated readMaf function. patient.id Select specific patients. method Approach construct phylogenetic trees. Choose one "NJ"(Neibor-Joining), "MP"(maximum parsimony), "ML"(maximum likelihood), "FASTME.ols" "FASTME.bal". min.vaf minimum value vaf. Default 0. bootstrap.rep.num Bootstrap iterations. Default 500. group list used indicate sample groups group.colors array indicates colors sample groups. title title plot. ... parameters getPhyloTree function. hexpand_ratio: hexpand ratio. see hexpand

title: plotMutTree plots phylogenetic tree of mutations — plotMutTree
code: library(MesKit) data.type <- "split1"  maf <- readMaf(   mafFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.mutation.txt", data.type)),   ccfFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.CCF.txt", data.type)),   clinicalFile = system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", sprintf("meskit.%s.clinical.txt", data.type)),   refBuild = "hg19",   ccf.conf.level = 0.95 )  # construct a group group <- list(   Coad = paste0("Coad_", 1:5),   OveryLM = paste0("OveryLM_", 1:5),   OveryRM = paste0("OveryRM_", 1:6),   UterusM = paste0("UterusM_", c(1, 3)) )  plotMutTree(maf, patient.id = "Met1", group = group, title = "CRC Met")

title: plotVafCluster — plotVafCluster
text: Plot variant clustering sample using combination box, violin jitter plots.

title: plotVafCluster — plotVafCluster
code: plotVafCluster(   variants,   cluster.col.name = "cluster",   vaf.col.names,   clone.colors = NULL,   violin = FALSE,   box = TRUE,   jitter = TRUE,   founding.cluster = 1,   output.file = NULL,   highlight = NULL,   highlight.note.col.name = NULL )

title: plotVafCluster — plotVafCluster
text: variants data frame variants. least cluster column VAF CCF columns required. Cluster column contain cluster identities continuous integer values starting 1. cluster.col.name column names containing cluster information (Default = "cluster"). vaf.col.names column names samples containing VAF. clone.colors setting clone colors. violin whether plotting violin (Default = FALSE). box whether plotting box (Default = TRUE). jitter whether plotting jitter plot (Default = TRUE). founding.cluster name founding clones, one important parameters. circumstances, founding cluster cluster highest average CCF cluster. output.file output file name (Default = NULL) highlight column name indicate whether highlight sites (TRUE FALSE). highlight.note.col.name highlight context.

title: plotVafCluster — plotVafCluster

title: Visualize the trees — viewTrees
code: # This dist file is the output of MEDICC dist <- system.file(package = "MPTevol", "extdata", "tree_final.dist")  # plot CNA trees without colored samples. plotCNAtree(dist = dist)  # create a list to indicate the sample groups. grp <- list(   NORMAL = "NORMAL",   Breast = paste0("Breast_", 1:5),   Coad = paste0("Coad_", 1:5),   Lung = paste0("Lung_", 1:5),   OveryLM = paste0("OveryLM_", 1:5),   OveryRM = paste0("OveryRM_", 1:6),   UterusM = paste0("UterusM_", c(1:7)) )  plotCNAtree(dist = dist, grp = grp)
